problem.question: What is returned by the method call rec(4)?
problem.code:
public static int rec(int x){
  if(x <= 1)
    return 1;
  else
    return x + rec(x - 1);
}

problem.question: What is returned by the method call two(7)?
problem.code:
public static int two(int x){
  if( x <= 2 )
    return 1;
  else
    return 1 + two( x - 2 );
}

What is returned by the method
call self(11)?
problem.code:
public static int self(int n){
  if( n <= 0 )
    return 0;
  else
    return 1 + self( n - 2 );
}

problem.question:
Find f(7) according to the recursive function definition shown on the
right. You may use the space below to do your work.
            
f(7) =

What is returned by the method 
call recurs(7)?
problem.code:
public int recurs(int n){
  int result = 0;
  if( n <= 3 )
    result = 2;
  else
    result = recurs(n - 2) + (n - 2);
  return result;
}

problem.question:
What is returned by the method 
call loopy("", 5) ?
problem.code:
public static String loopy(String s, int x){
  if( x <= 0 )
     return s;
  else
     return x + s + loopy(s, x - 2);
}

problem.question:
What is returned by the method
call again(1)?
problem.code:
public static int again(int x){
  int result = 0;
  if( x <= 0 )
    result = 2;
  else
    result = 2 + again( x - 1 );
  return result;
}

problem.question:
What is returned by the following method call?

ways(new int[]{5, 3, 6, 3}, 15, 0 )
problem.code:
public static int ways(int[] ds,int g, int c){
  int result = 0;
  if( c == ds.length ){
    if( g == 0 )
      result = 1;
  } else {
    for(int i = 1; i <= ds[c]; i++)
      result += ways(ds, g - i, c + 1);
  }
  return result;
}

problem.question: What is output by the method call change(11) ?
problem.code:
//pre: n >= 0
public static void change(int n){
  if( n <= 2 )
    System.out.print( n );
  else{
    change( n / 3 );
    System.out.print( n % 3 );
  }
}

problem.question:
Which of the following best describes 
what will occur if the precondition 
of method change is not met?
problem.code:
//pre: n >= 0
public static void change(int n){
  if( n <= 2 )
    System.out.print( n );
  else{
    change( n / 3 );
    System.out.print( n % 3 );
  }
}
problem.b:
The method call will result in
an infinite loop.
problem.e:
The value of the parameter n
will be printed out.

problem.question: What is returned by f(0,4)?
problem.code:
public static int f(int x, int y) {
  if (x==0) return 1+y;
  if (y==0) return f(x-1,1);
  return f(x-1, f(x,y-1));
}
